description: The installation of the security updates related to the Windows Mobile Broadband driver (KB5037771, KB5037770, KB5037768) may lead to observable instability in systems running various builds, including Windows 10 and Windows 11. Users may experience unexpected application crashes or system slowdowns as the underlying driver behaves unpredictably after the update. This behavior can manifest during routine tasks, resulting in a frustrating experience where users are intermittently unable to connect to mobile broadband services. Additionally, some users might encounter error messages indicating that their connection is unstable or has failed, particularly affecting Windows builds 10.0.19045.4412 and 10.0.22631.3593. This issue is particularly significant for environments relying heavily on mobile connectivity for critical operations.
